Class UserSettingsManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.eth.scu.importer.common.settings.UserSettingsManager

  • public class UserSettingsManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Commodity class to manage the AnnotationTool user application properties
    Author:
    Aaron Ponti

        Returns:
        name with full path of the properties files

      • getSettingValue

        public java.lang.String getSettingValue(java.lang.String name)
        Return the value of the setting for current server.
        Parameters:
        name - setting name
        Returns:
        the value of the attribute for current setting.

      • getServer

        public java.lang.String getServer()
        Return the URL of current openBIS server
        Returns:
        the URL of current openBIS server.

      • load

        public boolean load()
        Try reading settings from file. If loading fails, current settings are left untouched.
        Returns:
        true if the settings were loaded correctly, false otherwise.

      • save

        public boolean save()
        Try writing settings to file. If writing fails, use getLastErrorMessage() to get the details. This function might require write access to a restricted system folder. It should be used only in code run with admin privileges.
        Returns:
        true if the properties were saved successfully, false otherwise

      • getLastErrorMessage

        public java.lang.String getLastErrorMessage()
        Return last error message.
        Returns:
        last error message.

      • settingsFileExists

        public static boolean settingsFileExists()
        Check whether the properties file already exists
        Returns:
        true if the properties file already exists, false otherwise.
